Reviews.Title: Great laptop for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Kyle E. Miller
Reviews.Content: This laptop in an incredible machine for the price that I paid. As listing all of the pro's of this laptop would take a lot longer than listing the cons, lets just skip to the bad stuff. It's a black laptop, so the grease on your fingers is visible on it. A previous review stated that the left click on the touchpad was too loud. I agree completely. If you're going to play Cookie Clicker in church, people will look at you funny. Other than that, there have been no downsides whatsoever. The onboard chipset runs all of the games that I play at acceptable framerates (Dota 2 on low runs at about 45fps steadily). I multi-task, browse the internet, play games, write reports, draw up spreadsheets, all at the same time. No slowdown, no nonsense. I would definitely recommend this laptop, and in fact I already have.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Richard Miller
Reviews.Content: For the price I got (350) this laptop has all the specs i need to be successful in college and maybe beyond.In my first couple days, my only complaint is the loud mouse button....

Reviews.Title: Great laptop.
Reviews.Author: Sylvia A. Gardner
Reviews.Content: The quality and price of this laptop make it a good choice for anyone.  The screen resolution is great as well.

Reviews.Title: Its a good little home laptop, silent, powerful, affordable, lightweight with nice design.
Reviews.Author: kissa
Reviews.Content: Indeed, its a good little home laptop, silent, but powerful. I have had it about one month with no issues so far. IT does everything for my needs. It will be smart to get rid of Win. 8 and install  Win. 7 on it as I did. Its a easy task. Backlight keys would have been made this laptop very popular for typing and even light-gaming. The only thing to mention as downside is the cheap/load sound of touchpad L/R clicks is annoying. Get a mouse! Overall I recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Non-Gamer
Reviews.Author: Lucy N.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom.  It has Windows 8 which worried me a little, but it was actually easy to set up.  The best part of this computer is that it has a USB3 port & also has a DVD-RW drive.  A lot of the cheaper laptops don't come with a DVD/CD drive, making installing old software impossible.  This allowed me to install software I already owned (Office & Photoshop) without having to purchase new copies from the cloud!  I gave the computer to my mom for Xmas and had all of the software that she would need installed, showed her how to customize the layout and she's off and running.  Still not a fan of Windows 8, but a fan of the computer overall :)

Reviews.Title: Great hardware at this price level.
Reviews.Author: F. Klein
Reviews.Content: I bought this for $349 on Amazon with free shipping. I buy computers based on components rather than brand. This computer has an I3 processor that is significantly faster than the usual processor at this price level. The 4GB of RAM is more than adequate. The main complaint I have with the computer is Windows 8 and the way Dell has scattered stuff across multiple partitions. Windows 8 can be improved by downloading something called "Classic Shell" (find the website by Googling) that gives you a standard "Start Menu" reminiscent of XP, Vista, or Windows 7.Another issue, for those who buy Windows computers to dual boot them with Linux is that the UEFI (standard on newer Windows computers) makes this more difficult. I was able to install Ubuntu 13.04 after defragmenting, then shrinking the main C: partition within Windows using Disk Manager, then running the Ubuntu install disk using Legacy mode in the Bios. To get to Legacy mode, you have to press F8 as the computer starts to boot, then searching through the fields until you can enable it. Then, when the computer reboots, you have to press F12 to allow booting from the 13.04 DVD (13.04 install disk takes up 800MB--more than most CD's). I then had to use "Boot Repair," a Lubuntu based application downloadable and burned to a CD from the Ubuntu website. A warning to Ubuntu users:  12.04 did not support either wired or wireless internet with this computer. I have not tried wired with 13.04 as wireless worked well. Now that Ubuntu is installed alongside Windows, I can go to my usual practice of using Windows only to back up my IPOD.

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Katherine Majzner
Reviews.Content: I got this computer for school, and it works perfectly. The mouse pad is loud, so I use a mouse and the covering is really cheap. The cheap casing makes it really uncomfortable to rest your arms on, and I can only type for so long until I have marks on my arms and it  hurts too much to use.

Reviews.Title: Good for normal use
Reviews.Author: Ronak
Reviews.Content: Its cheap. I got it for $385.Its good for normal use. i3 processor is smooth.But the down side of this laptop is that it has Windows 8. I would prefer Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Single Pane Window
Reviews.Content: Perfect affordable basic student laptop.  The mutli-gesture touchpad is wonky but can be disabled to be a basic touchpad and then everything is great.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Lalita and her kitchen
Reviews.Content: I love many thing about this computer. I have it for a year now. For its size, it is pretty light. I have a shoulder problem but I still manage to carry this computer everywhere without aching pain. It is super affordable. Our company choose this computer for all of us to do our day to day basis computer work. I love the number pad like old school key board. I'm a young professional and I like how sleek it looks. I was a little worried because I owe Mac before that. Now I have put away in a storage and focus on this one.One negative thing I ran into is virus. I had my computer unprotected from virus for about four months and eventually it got invaded. I had to upload a few cleaning programs to bring it back together. Right now it is still in a recuperating status, need 10% more work to clean it up completely--well, hopefully.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Jhon Ewards Clociel Mata
Reviews.Content: excellent, very fast, compact, the keyboard is great, the windoes 8 is difficult to adapt not very hot, the speed of connection to the wifi is excellent, I loved

Reviews.Title: Like it but..
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Sumner
Reviews.Content: Nice fast computer. Well priced. Wish it had Windows 7. Windows 8 might be OK for a touchscreen..in my opinion too much overkill.

Reviews.Title: good prouduct
Reviews.Author: blondie01
Reviews.Content: so far I love my laptop my only complaint is windows 8 hard to get use to and I hate how when Im looking something up on the desktop it randomly switches over to windows 8 !! other then that great laptop also don't like how it stains the cover of the lap top with finger prints anyway I give it 4 star so far so good!! I defiantly recommend !

Reviews.Title: Weak battery
Reviews.Author: Primebot
Reviews.Content: Everything works good except for the battery.  Our battery last about 1.5 hours with the screen brightness turned all the way down.  I am wondering if this is a warranty issue or if this is still falling within spec considering its less than 2 months old.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: G. Uhrich
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a fantastic laptop.  It's great for everyday use.  It's pretty fast for being an Core i3.  The DVD writer is pretty basic, but it gets the job done.  The two USB 3.0 ports are a plus and makes things like backups a quick and painless job.  It's not going to play the latest and greatest games, but then again, no one would buy a laptop for that, but it will play some older and less graphics intensive games.  Wirelessly, it works like a champ.  Quick startup and shutdown.  I swapped out the HDD for an SSD and it is now on par with my home built desktop with regard to speed and responsiveness.  With the SSD, I am now getting almost six hours of battery time.  The touchpad is sensitive, but not too sensitive, and the keyboard is nice and big, with all the keys you would find on the standard keyboard.  The monitor is crisp and bright.  The speakers, like all laptop speakers, leave a lot to be desired, so listening to music on this probably won't be something you do on a regular basis, but they are adequate.  All in all, this is a great computer.  This is my first Intel processor based computer in almost twelve years, and I am impressed.

Reviews.Title: Item Damaged
Reviews.Author: Harinath Reddy
Reviews.Content: I found background light on Upper right corner on screen. So I got damaged Item, I am not sure how to review it.

Reviews.Title: Okay Computer
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: Processor was not as powerful as expected despite the i3 status.  Only use for academic needs such as word docs.

Reviews.Title: It gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Ryan A. Melendez "-Ryan Melendez"
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have spectacular specs, but it's a good PC for people just looking for something to surf the web with. Think of it like a  Chromebook that runs Windows, because surfing the web and Office would be the only things this thing can do well. I wouldn't try gaming with it, as the processor might not provide enough power. It serves what I want it to do though.

Reviews.Title: My very first laptop, squee!
Reviews.Author: JoJoeh
Reviews.Content: I know the title may seem unprofessional but I was and are still overjoyed with the performance of this laptop. I will admit, I'm not a fan at all of Windows 8 but, any person can get over that and still use the laptop with some ease. The black matte finish of the laptop can become "decorated" with the mess of oily fingerprints and the laptop itself is fragile as it is lightweight. All-in-all, you can familiarize the laptop all you own and I-don't-know, do with the laptop as you would any other laptop! Also, the price is amazing so if you just want a laptop for everyday use, then this is simply just, the laptop for you..."here ya go," I'd say.

Reviews.Title: Good Value but done't expect to upgrade OS to 8.1
Reviews.Author: Glenn E. Rhodes "glenner"
Reviews.Content: I ordered on Black Fri deal and unit arrived today. Out of the box I am impressed for the value offered.  One issue is that when connecting to the Microsoft Store it is not offered a free upgrade to Win 8.1 as advertised on AMZN page.  Unfortunately, AMZN customer service agent gave me only a the phone number to the MS store and nothing else.  The upgrade is certainly NOT worth the hassle of the time this would require.  I'll staff with live with 8.0 and run Chromium most of the time.  Rest of machine looks sound so far.

Reviews.Title: Drivers
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel
Reviews.Content: The drivers in the laptop didn't work properly and gave me a lot of problem when re installing my Win8 professionnal version.

Reviews.Title: Infected with worm
Reviews.Author: Donna Faxon Gillis
Reviews.Content: The computer came infected with a worm and link to illigitamate source for repairs. I did not know what to do but rely on the scam.  They said they were Microsoft  technicians,  Wanted 4100. to make repairs,  I agreed to pay but did not send check!this is the information given to me by these criminal:PCUPDATE SUPPORT LLLCsupport@updatesupport.com10 Cheswold Blvd. 1-DNewark, DE 19713This was a terrible experience and I would not advise anyone to but a computer from Amazon, because of it.  You shoulld have safeguards in place to prevent these kinds of traps and issues with electronic equipment!!!I finallly got Dell to repair and remove spyware planted bt these criminals!I'm nearly 70 years old and didn't really know what to do. I won't buy from you again!Donna Faxon Gillisdfgillis@msn.com

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: azra naveed
Reviews.Content: It's not working properly , there is some problem with it n even hard drive is not working. Please help

3rd Generation Intel Core i3-3227U processor (3M Cache, 1.9 GHz), Windows 8
4GB DDR3 Memory (1 DIMM) Max supported 8GB DDR3 Memory
500GB 5400rpm Hard Drive, 8X CD / DVD Burner (Dual Layer DVD+/-R Drive)
15.6 inch LED Backlit Display with Truelife and HD resolution (1366 x 768), Intel HD Graphics 4000
8-in-1 Media Card Reader and USB 3.0, HDMI, Bluetooth,
ProductInfo.Name: Dell Inspiron i15RV-3763BLK 15.6-Inch Laptop
